intro: Costularia brevicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved costularia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in woodlands and along stream banks. Costularia brevicaulis is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
